definitions.title: n. m.
definitions.body: prefect, ruler (loan-word fr. As. šaknu, prefect of conquered city or province (√ šakânu, set, appoint Dl:HWB 659, cf. Schr:COT Is 41, 25; appar. = NH [[סָגׇן]], [[סֶגֶן]], Aram. [[סִגְנׇא]] a superior (not high) priest; Mand. [[אשגאנדא]] WBrandt:Mand. Schriften 169 a candidate for priesthood; cf. Jen in Brandt:ib.; hence perh. Gk. zwga/nhv, cf. Lewy:Fremdw. 129);—only pl. [[סְגׇנִים]] Ez Eze 23:6 + 14 t.; sf. [[סְגׇנֶיהָ]] Je 51:57 + v:Je 51:58 (where rd. prob. [[סְגׇנׇיו]] LXX Gie);—
prefects of Assyr. and Bab. Ez Eze 23:6, Eze 23:12, Eze 23:23, Je 51:23, Je 51:57 (all + [[פַּחוֹת]]), Is 41:25, of king of Medes Je 51:28 (+ [[פַּחוֹת]]).

petty rulers, officials of Judah (only Ne Ezr in sources): disting. from [[חׂרִים]] nobles Ne 2:16, Ne 4:8, Ne 4:13, Ne 5:7, Ne 7:5; alone, Ne 2:16, Ne 12:40, Ne 13:11; + [[יְהוּדִים]] Ne 5:17 (v. also Ne 2:16); + [[שָׂרִים]] Ezr 9:2. Cf. BAram. [[סְגַן]].
